public: override bool CanConvertFrom(System::ComponentModel::ITypeDescriptorContext ^ context, Type ^ sourceType);

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
A that represents the type you want to convert from.
Docs.summary: Returns whether this converter can convert the specified object to a object.
Docs.returns: if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This implementation returns `true` only for a `sourceType` that is assignable to <xref:System.IO.Stream>. All other `sourceType` types return `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ConvertFrom (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ConvertFrom(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value) cil managed
Public Overrides Function ConvertFrom (context As ITypeDescriptorContext, culture As CultureInfo, value As Object) As Object
public: override System::Object ^ ConvertFrom(System::ComponentModel::ITypeDescriptorContext ^ context, System::Globalization::CultureInfo ^ culture, System::Object ^ value);

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
The to use as the current culture.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified stream to a new object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value for `context` must provide services for <xref:System.Xaml.IXamlSchemaContextProvider>, <xref:System.Xaml.IRootObjectProvider>, <xref:System.Xaml.IXamlObjectWriterFactory>, and <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IProvideValueTarget>. The schema context when <xref:System.Xaml.IXamlSchemaContextProvider> is queried must be an internally implemented XAML schema context that is particular for BAML usages. This prevents most user code scenarios from using <xref:System.Windows.DeferrableContentConverter>.

Docs.exception:
is not able to provide the necessary XAML schema context for BAML.
